Dear Mr. Scheuer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Title conditions, books, records, and reports; access by
department, bureau of fire services, or local authorities;
records; report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
information; availability of confidential records; child
information cards to be provided to department; failure of
licensee to cooperate with investigation, inspection, or
examination.
Rule Code & (C) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department,
Section and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household
Description members, to provide accurate and truthful information to the
department.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that an agency worker forged a signature on a
document.
Investigation Complainant was notified on October 29, 2024, via telephone
and a voice mail message was left.
Chief Administrator was notified of the complaint on November
15, 2024, via email and a return phone call was requested.
District Manager was contacted via email on November 20,
2024, and a message left requesting a return phone call.
The District Manager was interviewed via telephone on
December 5, 2024. The District Manager acknowledged that Staff
1, an agency foster care worker, had signed the name of the Bio-
Mother on a “Authorization to Release Information” document. The
District Manager reported that Staff 1 signing Bio-Mothers name
on the form was not permitted and that disciplinary action against
Staff 1 has been initiated. District Manager reported Staff 1 had
said she obtained permission from Bio-Mother to sign her name
on the form however, District Manager reported the signing of a
person’s name with or without permission is prohibited.
Staff 1 was interviewed on December 6, 2024, via telephone.
Staff 1 acknowledged she had signed Bio-Mothers name on the
“Authorization to Release Confidential Information” form, dated
September 28, 2022. Staff 1 reported she had obtained Bio-
Mother’s permission to sign her name on the form. Staff 1 was
2

asked why she had not submitted the form to Bio-Mother for her
signature. Staff 1 reported she was very busy with other job duties
and could not get out to Bio-Mothers house to obtain the
signature. Staff 1 reported she was under pressure from the Court
referee in this case to submit the signed form to the Court. Staff 1
reported it was her fault for signing Bio-Mothers name on the form
and she should not have done that.
The Social Services Manager was interviewed via telephone
on December 9, 2024. The Social Services Manager
acknowledged Staff 1 had signed the name of Bio-Mother on the
Authorization to Release Confidential Information form. Social
Services Manager reported Staff 1 was under pressure to submit
the signed form to the Court. Social Services Manager reported
Staff 1 had reported she had obtained permission from Bio-Mother
to sign her name on the form however this practice is not
permitted. Social Services Manager reported Staff 1 has problems
with effective time management related to her job.
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on December
10, 2024. Complainant reported Bio-Mother would never have
given permission for Staff 1 to sign her name on the form.
Complainant reported she thinks Staff 1 was under pressure to
submit a signed Authorization to Release Confidential Information
form to the Court and so she signed the name of Bio-Mother on
the form.
The Bio-Mother was interviewed via telephone on December
12, 2024. Bio-Mother reported that she never gave permission for
Staff 1 to sign her name on the September 28, 2022, Authorization
to Release Confidential Information form. Bio-Mother reported she
has not been very cooperative with the agency and her
relationship with Staff 1 is not very good and reiterated that this is
a reason she would not have given permission for Staff 1 to sign
her name.
Documents Reviewed:
• An Authorization to Release Confidential Information dated
September 28, 2022, was reviewed and documents the
signature of the Bio-Mother with Staff 1’s signature as a
witness on the form.
Analysis Staff 1 acknowledged she had signed the name of the Bio-Mother
on the September 28, 2022, Authorization to Release Confidential
Information form.
The District Manager and the Social Services Manager
acknowledged that Staff 1 had signed the name of the Bio-Mother
3

on the aforementioned document. The Bio-Mother denied she had
signed the form.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
